required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study With an Open-Label Active Control to Evaluate the Potential of Nestorone® to Delay Cardiac Repolarization in Healthy Female Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Randomized, Crossover Design Study With an Open-Label Active Control to Evaluate the Potential of Nestorone® to Delay Cardiac Repolarization in Healthy Female Volunteers: A Thorough QT/QTc Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the effect of Nestorone (NES) administered as an bolus injection on the corrected QT interval using Fridericia's formula (QTcF).

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effect of Nestorone (NES) administered as an IV solution on the corrected QT interval using Fridericia's formula (QTcF).
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of any changes from baseline in heart rhythm using an electrocardiogram at different time points after receiving NES as an IV solution

arm_group.description: Subjects will be randomized to a treatment sequence on Day 1 of Treatment Period 1, prior to administration of investigational product, according to a randomization schedule provided by the Sponsor
Subjects will be randomized to a treatment sequence on Day 1 of Treatment Period 1, prior to administration of investigational product, according to a randomization schedule provided by the Sponsor
Subjects will be randomized to a treatment sequence on Day 1 of Treatment Period 1, prior to administration of investigational product, according to a randomization schedule provided by the Sponsor

facility.name: Harbor Hospital, 3001 South Hanover Street, 7th Floor

clinical_study.keyword: Nestorone use as an IV solution on heart rate;
Abnormality in Heart Rate or Rhythm, Unspecified as to Time of Onset
